privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Protecting your personal data is our priority. Read how we collect, use, and safeguard your information.

overview.title: Overview
overview.summary: Personal Data Protection at ALFA Foreign Language Centers
content: This Privacy Policy covers the collection and management of personal data at ALFA Foreign Language Centers, which have been operating since 1986.
We are committed to protecting the personal data of students, parents, and collaborators in accordance with Greek legislation and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
Our policy fully complies with Law 4624/2019 and GDPR provisions.

collection.title: Data Collection
collection.summary: What data we collect and why
content: We collect personal data such as names, ages, phone numbers, email addresses and home addresses for educational purposes.
Data is collected during student registration and used for organizing classes, assessment and communication with parents.
We also collect attendance data, grades and progress notes for the educational process.
Medical information is collected only with explicit consent for allergies and special educational needs.

usage.title: Data Usage
content: Data is used for organizing classes, assessing progress and communicating with parents.
We inform parents about their children's progress through regular meetings and progress checks.
Data is used for issuing certificates and preparing for certification exams.
We do not share data with third parties without explicit consent, except when required by law.

protection.title: Data Protection
content: We use modern security systems and physical protections to safeguard data.
Data is stored in secure environments with limited access only to authorized personnel.
We implement necessary technical and organizational measures for privacy protection according to GDPR requirements.
All staff have signed confidentiality agreements and attend regular data protection seminars.

rights.title: Your Rights
content: You have the right to request access to your data and information about its processing.
You can request correction, update or deletion of data that is inaccurate or no longer needed.
You have the right to withdraw your consent at any time and request restriction of processing.
You can request the transfer of your data to another processing entity.

retention.title: Data Retention
content: Educational data is retained for as long as the student attends classes and for 5 years after graduation.
Communication data is retained for 3 years from the last contact.
Data required by law is retained according to legal requirements.
After the retention period expires, data is securely deleted.

privacy.importantText: This privacy policy may be updated periodically to comply with legislative developments.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: Carefully read the terms of participation and cooperation at ALFA Foreign Language Centers.

overview.title: General Terms
content: These terms govern your participation in ALFA Foreign Language Centers programs, which have been operating since 1986.
By registering, you fully accept these terms and the school's operational regulations.
We reserve the right to modify these terms, with prior notification to parents and students.

registration.title: Registration and Participation
content: Registration begins September 1st for new students, for existing students at the end of each academic year.
Securing a place in the preferred class is only possible with payment of the registration fee.
Required registration documents: Registration form, proof of registration payment.
The registration fee secures the student's place in the class and is non-refundable.

fees.title: Financial Obligations
content: Tuition fees are annual, covering the respective academic year and vary according to grade level.
Fees can be paid in full by mid-October or in equal monthly installments.
A 10% discount for the current academic year is provided for the second child of the same family.
A 35% discount for the current academic year is provided for children attending a second language.

attendance.title: Attendance and Absences
content: No distinction is made between excused and unexcused absences.
Regular class attendance is a guarantee for student progress.
Anyone absent from class must notify the Administration.
In case of absences from important classes, 'Office Hours' are provided for additional help.

evaluation.title: Evaluation and Promotion
content: During the academic year, tests are conducted on the taught material.
Participation in tests is mandatory for all students.
Students who achieve 50% of the total score are promoted to the next level.
Tests are delivered to parents during information meetings.

parentMeetings.title: Parent Information
content: Parents are invited at regular intervals for information about their children's performance.
Parent-teacher cooperation is valuable for students' good progress.
Information is not provided during teachers' breaks.
If attendance is not possible, request a new appointment from the Administration.

behavior.title: Classroom Behavior
content: Students must arrive at the school 2-3 minutes before class starts.
Students must behave respectfully towards classmates and teachers.
Disrupting the class in any way is prohibited.
The Administration reserves the right to expel without refund students who consistently behave inappropriately.

history.title: Our History
history.paragraph1: Our first school was born in 1986 in Nea Filadelfeia, with the vision to give a new dimension to foreign language learning.
history.paragraph2: With dedication, passion and proper scientific training, we created relationships of trust with students and parents, achieving continuous success in exams.
history.paragraph3: Our journey continued in 1996 in Chalandri, always with the same goal: modern, methodical and effective education.

whyLearn.question: Why should I learn a foreign language?
whyLearn.answer: Learning foreign languages enhances memory, critical thinking, socialization and opens doors for studies and work worldwide.

age.question: What is the appropriate age?
age.answer: From 1st grade, children have the ability to learn a foreign language easily, naturally and creatively.

difficulties.question: What about children with learning difficulties?
difficulties.answer: With the right methodology, even children with dyslexia can successfully learn a foreign language.
